intro: Henriettea aggregata, commonly known as the clustered henriettea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and compact growth habit. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in late spring to early summer. Henriettea aggregata thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and requires partial to full sunlight for optimal growth. It is often cultivated in rock gardens or as a decorative plant due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
